articles.title: Hail No! NBC, Climate Change Isn't Making Hail More Damaging
articles.author: Anthony Watts
articles.summary: NBC News reports that climate change could make hailstones up to 75 percent larger due to stronger storm updrafts caused by climate change. This claim is false and misleading, lacking any evidentiary support. Scientific data shows that there is no observable increase in hail intensity due to climate change and hail damage costs have increased over time due to development and property values in hail-prone areas.

articles.title: What happens if Canada's thickest glaciers disappear?
articles.summary: The St. Elias mountain range is home to the world's largest non-polar icefields. In recent years, climate change has caused glaciers within the icefields to melt at a rapid rate. People in communities whose lives have been shaped by glaciers for generations are worried about their disappearance.
